text: Une astringence en finale et un sursaut dammoniac lempêche dêtre dans la même catégorie que les autres. Je préfère le Simcoe comme complément est le seul constat que je peux faire.
Draft. Light golden yellow pour with white head. Light herbal flavors with grassy and citrus undertones. Aroma is light citrus and herbal hop tones.

750 ml growler thx Heather and Frank A: tropical pineapple, grapefruit, piny app: hazy pale white head. T/p: thin body with long bitter finish. O: Simple and beautiful. Amazing aroma . I could drink it again and again.

Pour is like all their hop growlers, hazed pale yellow and a tight white head. Nose is quite strong, soft citrus notes up front turning into an earthy and very herbal tea with notes of grassy hops. Taste is more earthy up front, herbal tea notes and hints of grass. Finish is citrus with a touch of mango and moderate bitterness. Light body, well carbonated, and semi dry. Very soft feel, very nicely done.
hazy yellow pour with a thick creamy white head. smell and taste of pine, citrus notes, bitter grapefruit pith. Juicy flavor notes, really nice hop

Pour from growler, 04/02/2014. Pours light hazy orange, creamy white head dies to foamy swirl on the surface, thick soapy lacing left behind. Aroma is honeyed tangerine pulp and grapefruit, fluffy layer of pine hops, biscuit. Taste is lemon, grapefruit, juicy, with stronger pine hop bitterness coming through, lingering in the finish with toasted malts. Medium light body, bright and juicy hop notes with dry finish. Tasty, well done.

Pours from a swingtop bottle a hazy blonde color with a medium white head that burns away steadily. Partial rings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of floral hops, citrus and malt. Light-bodied with flavors of herbal hops, grapefruit and toasted malt. The finish is mildly bitter with a lingering citrusy hops aftertaste. Solid APA all around.

750ml growler in a tulip. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of citrusy and resinous and lightly fruity hops, pale malts, and light doughiness. Flavor the same with an incredible hoppiness. Average texture. Another awesome HF beer.
Taster @ Hill Farmstead. Expression du Simcoe (pin, agrumes) dans sa plus simple expression, avec la bouche raffraichissante et la pureté Hill Farmstead.

Draught at Prohibition Pig on 3/15/14Strong white head tops the slightly hazy orange-golden body.Much softer and easier than the Zero Gravity Sim City Extra IPA I just had, thankfully. Honey, tangerines, lemon and just a touch of pine on the end. Medium to medium-high strength of aroma. Almost marmalade-like in its sweet and orange-like presentation. No alcohol or flaws. Perhaps a touch of blandness from the sediment in suspension?Light bitterness plays about a fluffy, very airy textured beer. Touches of wateriness, light honeysuckle sweetness and some vibrant tangerine-apricot-like hop flavors are all pleasant. Extremely dry, well-attenuated beer seems like it could actually use a touch more hop juiciness or malt sweetness. Just something to enliven it and balance all of this dry malt and dry, nearly astringent hop bitterness on the finish. Great carbonation levels and appropriate body, though, with no flaws or alcohol noted. Very marmalade-y....

Had on tap at Prohibition Pig. $6.50 for the full 16 oz. serving. To tulip, it pours a hazy pale Gatorade greenish-yellow with which a minimal, snowy white ringed head half a finger in length stood. Tastes and smells of Bible paper, krill oil, cilantro, spearmint, musk, and passionfruit. Yeasty and refreshing. Although a few have disagreed with me, it was like drinking a bitter, lemon-lime seltzer water. Thin and smooth.
Tap at Pro Pig. Pours cloudy yellow with a small clingy white head. Aroma of mango, pineapple. Taste follows nose. Finish is grassy bitterness.

A: Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head, Decent Lacing

S: Grapefruit, Orange Rind

T: Grapefruit Rind, Mild Grainy Malt

M: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Drying

Overall, a pretty solid Pale ale, outstanding nose, milder on the taste.

22nd October 2011Cloudy amber beer, good white head. Light crisp palate. Mild minerals. Good fresh orangey hops, floral as well. A little brett - is this mildly infected? Doesnt really matter as it doesnt dominate. Bitterness ramps up toward the dry finish.

750 mL growler, thanks Conor! Shared watching football in a Hill Farmstead wine glass.

Pours a dark, dull golden bronze color with a wispy finger of white head and a thin collar throughout and light lacing. Aroma is straight Simcoe, with strong fresh pine notes and light citrus hops. Flavor is dominated by pine hops, minimal bitterness and a stronger than expected malt body. Not much citrus presence or bitterness in the finish. Body is a little lighter than expected from this series and lacking smoothness in the finish. Simcoe is a little heavy throughout, but still a very enjoyable APA.

On tap at the Prohibition Pig in Waterbury.  Medium golden body, nice tight white cap, soapy lacing.  Nose is resinous with a fair bit of pine, grapefruit and grass as well as a light biscuity malt.  Flavor is more hop-forward with pine and grapefruit competing for center stage.  Medium bodied, assertive carbonation, moderate bitterness.

Slightly cloudy blonde with huge frothy head served in a tulip glass. Superb. Resinous and piney notes dominates the aromas with a touch of candied grapefruit. Average carbonation, lively palate, pretty dry. Super power Pale Ale! Very refreshing, delicious session beer.
On tap at Farmhouse Tap & Grill

A hazed blonde ale with a thin white head. In aroma, classic Hill Farmstead with pungent piney hops, a hint of lemon, nice and smooth. In mouth, a nice smooth biscuit malt with citrusy hops, light acidity, piney character, well done.  On tap at Ginger Man NYC, Sept 21, 2012.

Growler from the brewery,Hazy golden pour,big white head,excellent lacing.Big pine and lemon nose. Flavor brings the pine to the forefront,some malt sweetness and toast.Medium bodied but very crisp.More heavily hopped that Edward if you can believe that,but it works well.Finish is a long and lingering dry resin bitterness.

Citrusy floral hop aroma, strong enough to cut through some congestion from a lingering cold.  Pale, hazy straw color with moderate white head. Very crisp citrusy hoppiness!   

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap. Pours very hazy straw hay color. Foamy white head. Aroma is hoppy, apricot marmelade, orange, tropical fruits, fruity, sweet malts, honey, danky hops. Taste is grapefruit at the back end palate, nice malt sweetness, balanced, tropical fruits, orange, tangerine. A very nice APA!

Big growler courtesy of Drew n Kan. Thanks! Pours a well hazed golden hue, dulled and darker, with frothy offwhite head. Mellow layer laces small, loose bubbles. Aromas are rich simcoe, sweet and fruity, with grapefruit and bubblegum, lemons, grass, florals. Touches of bready malts, vibrant hop flavored nose. Good lemon and grapefruit as it warms, citrus punch through. Initial is lighter bodiedn vibrant richer Simcoe bitterness, bubblegum and lemons, firm grapefruit and florals. Nice flavors, richer fresh hop presence up front. Good citrus, florals, grass. Middle offers gentle fruit, tropical elements come on strong, sweet and a bit tart, bitter florals, citrus, grass. Backend is a touch sweet and bready, general mellow grainy sweetness. Richer and dry, small body, quite drinkable, good hop flavors. Tasty and light, fresh and sessionable. Nice.

Growler de 750 ml, merci beaucoup à David. Arômes très houblonnés montrant un mélange dagrumes, de conifères et de fruits tropicaux. Robe dorée et trouble, effervescence assez active et légère dentelle. En bouche, le houblon se montre assez mordant, très fruité et relativement résineux. Le corps de céréales est svelte et allégé par leffervescence assez active. Longue finale amère et résineuse. Une autre très belle pale ale/IPA de Hill Farmstead.

My Bottom Line:
Juicy tropical fruit (namely grapefruit and starfruit) quickly gain resinous qualities in this lean and prickly New World Pale Ale.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sizeable head of foam crowns the cloudy blond.
-These hop resins are also reminiscent of green peppercorns at times.
-Light straw notes appear under the hop bouquet.
-Resinous bitterness is lengthy but forgiving.
-Although intense, this remains a quenching hop-forward Pale Ale imbued with farmhouse "realness".

Growler and on tap at the brewery.</b

750 ml growler direct from the brewery. Cloudy golden/ orange body topped by a quickly dying, small off-white head. Nose is a delightful mixture of citrus hops, pine and sweet malt. Without sounding cheesy or sarcastic. What to take a guess what hop you are going to taste??? Dry bitter grapefruit, resin and a bit of orange. The bitterness is real strong with grapefruit. Lively mouthfeel with a nice effervescent touch. As with all of Hill Farmsteads Pale ales. Top notch!

750ml growler from brewery. Growler 2 days old. Sample on tap as well.
Appearance : Clear pale yellow with medium creamy and foamy head. Lots of lacing. Stunning look as always. Lasting head.

Aroma : Intense fruity notes with powerful floral and herbal notes. Mangoes, passion fruits and citrus notes. Very slightly grassy, but mostly floral and fruity notes. Silky malty notes that efficiently round up the sharp hoppy edges.

Taste : Great malt backbone under expressive floral and fruity hops. Arrival mostly malty with the fruits and the floral notes coming in fast. Finish is slightly bitter with floral and fruity notes and gets mostly floral on the late finish with some malt coming back. Very light resinous notes coming on the finish.

Palate :Carbonation is a bit softer than on tap but still nice. Fluffy and delicate carbonation that goes down well. Palate was a bit better at the brewery and Ill rate accordingly.

Overall : Stunning APA along the line of Edward. Awesome floral nose with just enough malt to sustain it without hiding it.Big bold fruity notes. Very light resinous notes which makes it even more drinkable. Top example of the style, pretty much equal to Edward. Cant get much better than this.

Growler shared by lushawn for the dinner Kylie made- thanks, guys! Pours a pale cloudy yellow color with a moderately sized white head. Aroma of herbal, floral, oniony hops, pale malts, grapefruit. The flavor is totally the same. Light-bodied, with a dry, resinous mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Really nice APA.

Bottle: The aroma consists of moderate pine and lighter grapefruit. It pours a dull orangish-yellow with two finger yellow tinged off-white head. The flavor starts with a quick dose of tropical fruits. The finish has a good dose of grapefruit and pine. Its light-medium bodied with moderate carbonation.

On tap at HF.
Pours hazy golden with white head and good lacing. Aroma is of pine, resinous, citrus. Taste is of pine, resinous, citrus. Very drinkable. A pretty good beer.

Swingtop shared by drewbeerme. Thanks! Pours an attractive pale gold with hop haze and a sticky white head. The nose is resiny and citrus. Cat pee is light overall. Some sticky malt notes come through as well, but this is all about the hops. Very clean. On tasting, crisp and notably bitter. Some sweet malt notes come through. The hops grow and almost hit a cloying note before the bitterness kicks in to dry it back out. Pretty nice overall.

Growler into tulip. Light yellow golden with a big tight white head.  Aroma is dank simcoe hops -  lots of pine, melon, citrus, herbs and lemon. Taste is pretty decent bitter, with a tangy and spicy tangerine, quite sweet. Excellent beer, but its just an all simcoe beer,tastes like youd expect it to, and i love simcoe!

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2012 Growler at Dans shared with friends. Big thanks to Adam for this one! Pour is hazy, honey with a frothy white head and great lacing. Big dank aroma, pine, resin, light garlic, light urine, and floral hops. Taste is much the same, huge weed, light onion, grass, flowers, and wheat ending with a big bitter finish. Light body with high carbonation. Really big flavors for such a sessionable beer. Another winner from Hill Farmstead.
Bitter, citrusy aroma. Floral flavor with a bitter, grape fruity finish. Pale yellow appearance.  A spot-on IPA.

Growler @ Dans house, courtesy of Steve_0. Thanks a bunch! Pours a milky yellow orange appearance with a bit small white head. Herbal, onion, honey, lemon citrusy, spicy hoppy aroma. A bit tangy tangerine/lemon citrusy, spicy herbal hoppy, grapefruity, juicy flavor. Pretty tasty, easy drinking beer.

Pour out of growler, thanks to Steve for the pour! Hazy as hell yellow straw pour with a nice slightly hazy white head, aroma brought notes of cat pee, lemon, some nice earthy tropical fruit, with pineapple, mango, touch of grassy and slightly piney notes.  Taste is a mix of lemon, grass, some nice pineapple, peach, hints of a dry, grassy spicy note, hints of nice yeast, finishing with some biscuit, dry and earthy tones.  Very nice APA.
Really nice grassy citrus flavor with little bitterness.  Light sweetness and rich deep flavors for such a low abv.  Another fantastic pale ale.

On tap at Pinocchios.  Cloudy orange with a diminishing white head.  Nose is grapefruit, cat and grass.  Medium body with a tingle.  Taste is nectarine, grapefruit, catty hops and mild honey with hints of orange peel and basil.  Text book pale but i was looking for a bit more.

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2012 tap drafts and 2L growlers guzzled galore.    aroma is clean fresh juicy grapefruit.   this is like straight out of an outkast song-  clean fresh, etc.    resin, dank hops.     leaves a bitter grapefruit presence on the palloot.  pretty nice stuff.

On tap at the brewery. Aroma redolent with pine and pale citrus. Flavors start really well with grapefruit and resin, very juicy and strong, but get intensely grassy and dusty in the finish, like too many dry hops. It throws the balance and finish off. Otherwise, very good.

on tap at hill farmstead festival. hazy pale golden with a nice white head, good retention and lacing. vegetal and light pine notes, fresh bread, crisp, haystack. average carbonation - some fizz, light body - oily, very nice piney-grapefruity medium long finish. very nice apa!

On draft and in a growler. Pale cloudy yellow pour with white head. Aroma is absolutely enchanting, just the right amount of super fresh citrusy hop, very subtle spruce notes, fresh grains, light peppery aroma as well, grapefruit, pineapple. Flavor is really balanced, not at all malty, but the hopiness is a perfect mix of resinous bitterness and fruity finishing hops, more grapefruit and pineapple. A definite favorite amongst pale ales.

On tap at Hill Farmstead Harvest Festival. Hazy yellow with a small long lasting creamy white head and good lacing. Fresh piney notes are very present in the aroma along with hints of lemon and orange. Taste is of pine and citrus. This is a very smooth APA. Alcohol isnt noticeable at all. Easy to drink.

Tap @ Pony w Streets waiting for my son and his dad. Hazy yellow like a witbier, fresh piney simcoe aroma. Piney turpentiney flavor with grapefruit, dry bitter at the very end, subtle veggie/leafy notes. No alcohol on palate.

Draft at pony bar.  Pours a bright murky orange body with thin active white lacing. Aroma is super fresh citrus, grapefruit peel and dank herb. Wow, extremely fresh. Mouthfeel is medium and wonderful with notes of fresh grapefruit, bitter orange, light tropical fruits, pine, resin and dank herb. Another awesome brew from HFS.

750ml from brewery. Pours a hazy yellow orange tinge with a finger of foam that settles quickly. On the nose is a complex arrangement of grapefruit, malt and earthy citrus notes. Ripe grapefruit, pine, earthy straw, malts, bitter finish... Yum, Yum, Yum.
on tap at hill farmstead festival, like a baby heady topper, dank and dense but with a light finish. Highly drinkable

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2012 On tap at farmhouse... Thought I had rated this one before... Pours a hazy lemony brown hue, slightly hazy, and topped with a soapy white head...pungent fresh citrus and resin aroma, fairly dank... Drinks with much of the same allure with a pronounced bitterness. ่Soft grains on the backend that gives way to a bitter pithy finish. Drinks easy but incredibly hoppy in the greatest way possible.

Picked up this growler today at Hill Farmstead. Enjoyed in an HFS wine glass at fridge temperature. 

A - Gorgeous bright hazy orange. 2 finger head that fades pretty fast and retains a slightly thin line of bubbles. 

S - Scent...well, its all Simcoe! Sort of a piney resinous with hints of lemons and oranges. Some pepper scent.

T - Excellent. The malts in this are totally hidden by the bitterness of the hops. Very smooth, nice balance. Lots of great citrus and some pine notes. 

M - This coats the tongue and keeps a sort of tingling throughout the tongue. Its nice. Medium body and carbonation.

O - One of my favorite hops balanced nicely with an incredibly smooth beer.

Sampled on tap at Hill Farmstead Brewery, pours a cloudy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is way less funky than the Riwaka, with some hay, slightly funky and citrusy hops, some slight sweet bready malts in the back. Flavour is very citrusy, with hay and mild funk; low hop astringency but theyre certainly there. Well-rounded, dominated by the citrus and hay. Great one.

At the brewery. Hazy golden yellow pour with a mountainous white froth. Huge explosions of all Ive come to know and love from Simcoe. Savory tropical fruit, apricot, and fresh herbal dankness finish with a citrus onslaught. The palate is more bitter than many of the other single hops, but it was right up my alley. Bone dry body with a super crisp finish. Awesome effort.
750 growler/bottle-shared by j12601-pours hazy yellow with white bubbles.  Aroma is lemon/pine.  Taste is lemon/pine/spice hops, drying, 2nd light malt.  Ok effervescence.

In short: An highly drinkable hop bomb.  Near perfect pale ale.
How: Tap at brewery + this rating for a very fresh 750ml growler consumed the day of purchase
The look: Partly cloudy golden-blond body topped by a persistent small off-white head
In long: Nice bright hoppy nose full of yellowed grass, light color fruits and dry wood notes.  The clean and crisp toasted malts offer just the right amount of caramel and honey.   The body is relatively full but it is so crisp that it feels light.  Hopping is bright and vibrant.  Bitter white grapefruits, dry wood, yellowed grass, tropical fruits.  Less piney and sandy than many other Simcoe IPAs Ive had in the past.  Bitterness level is in the med range and the long finish is also quite dry.  Im typing this rating as Im rating a fresh 750ml growler that I bought.  Earlier today at the brewery I had this beer side-by-side with the Edward (the regular Farmstead APA).  There are more similarities than differences between the two and I could tell that they both shared the same malt backbone and that Edward certainly uses a lot of Simcoe.  As I said they are pretty similar but the Edward offers an additional level of complexity that the Simcoe version doesnt have.  HF Simcoe is a superb APA, but when you know Edward tough to beat.  All in all, another kick-ass hoppy beer from Hill Farmstead.  I should drink a few pints of a nice session beer like this every morning when I get up, because my doctor said I really need to stop drinking big boozy beers on an empty stomach.

Growler shared by InspectorBob at the 11 SJBA gathering. Poured a dirty yellow body with a small light white head.  Aroma of dirty earth, sour lemons and a touch of milk. Flavor of dirty citrus, earth, hop cones, slight lemon zest, and grains. Body was delicate with soft carbonation and a light mouthfeel. Okay but not my favorite Hill Farmstead beer by any means.

Shared by InspectorBob at SJ BA gathering. Pours out a mostly clear light golden color with a small white head. Aroma is of pine, citrus, light cat piss, and light malty notes. Taste is pine, and nice citrus hops, sweet malt, and a very nice lingering hop bite at the end. Huge hop profile crammed into this 5.4% brew. Top notch.
On draft.  Orangish color with a slight haze and white head.  Simcoe comes through nice in the aroma.  A nice bitterness,  drinkable and refreshing.

On tap at the brewery, thanks to Shaun. Pours lightly hazy gold with a strong, white head. Notes of piney and citrusy hops in the aroma. Lovely flavor, moderately sweet with fruity bitterness. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Sturdy bitter finish, more tropical fruits and citrus, with pale malt sweetness. Great beer.
Growler courtesy GoT.  Big dang herbal nose with citrus secondary. Dry crackery malts, light to medium bodied. Lingering piney flavors. A real good drinker. Golder amber with a nice creamy head.

Beautiful tiny hop bomb. Resinous, detectable oils, background malt lightly toast, full aroma propelled by medium carbonation, body is lean and dry. It really doesnt get much more perfect and spare. Nailed it.

Big thanks to aapp for sending out a 750mL growler of this, and as well to imagineiii for sending one for us to share down here. Served in a tulip.

Pours a nice golden color with a several-finger white head. A bit of lacing on the way down and a collar throughout. The nose carries some nice light pine resin as well as some floral and citrus notes. Flavor dials up the pine quite a bit, taking it to the next level. Bitterness and pine work incredibly well together. Smooth bitterness in the finish, though not quite as smooth as with the Amarillo version, as the bitterness is a bit more heavy-handed, though no complaints about that. Another big hit in the single-hop series. Im glad someone is finally doing these things right.

750mL bottle, courtesy of joet. Thanks, Joe! Pours a hazy yellow color; thin white head. Vibrant pine and citrus character in the aroma; zesty and lightly herbal. Relaxed CO2; chewy, showing pine, citrus, and some supporting crystal malt / crystalline sugar; a touch undercarbonated and muddled, for me, but vibrant citrus here and a nice toasty finish.

Growler sample via and shared with oakbluff. Haze pale orange in colour with medium carbonation. Aromas are of tropical fruit, tangerine, mild pine, and pale malt. A nice hoppy blend on the palate with elements of tangerine, orange,, grapefruit, pine, and weeds, backed by a fair bit of pale malt flavour. Heavy bitterness, and a bit light bodied for the style. Perhaps a touch hollow on the palate, but still enjoyable.

So far the least impressive IPA outing for HF. Nose has the typical citrus and pine of an IPA, nothing special. Look is their typical cloudy orange you get from them, lighter than most though.  The guy at the Gutter says "really fucking good" but I jusy say really good. Or perhaps their other beers have spoiled me.

Thanks turd.  Pours a hazy lemonrind yellow with one finger of white head. Nose is resinous and piny, off fruit notes. Peachy/mango and some citrus. Resinous and some off citrus notes. Peach in the flavor too. Dry palate and medium body.  Tasty.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2011 750ml growler courtesy of Glouglouburp.  Thanks Dany!   Another great beer. Nose is more hop centered, resinous citrus and pine.  Lots of hops, maybe some light diacetyl--but it doesnt detract from the overall experience.  Great pale ale.

ah, ok, a fresh growler from hfs! yay! lol! very good stuff, love that its a super hoppy sessionable brew. pours a hazy amber with some brighter orange edges, nice fluffy white head that leaves some lacing. the aroma is very nice, pure simcoe, lots of floral, lemon, some sopay light astringency, terrific. the taste is of course also simcoe, simcoe and more simcoe. white grapefruit, bitter orange, some lemon juice, and some lighter floral notes bringing up the rear. yummy! delicious, great body, very light body wise, yet a pronounced bitterness with an oilier back palate. drinks very very well, super smooth. bitterness peak at about a 5, and fades pretty fast leaving you wanting another burst. this is definitely the best single hop simcoe brew ive had.
750 growler... bright medium gold... smells great, strong tropical fruits with a bit of dank... tastes just grassy from start to finish, lacks balance but drinkable

Pouring at Parker Pie when Andy, Max, Pearl and I went there for dinner after the Hill saison fest.  Then again from a growler I took to James mead tasting.  Pours a lightly hazed gold with a thin to medium sized white head.  Big sticky citrus, toast and malt.  Smooth, big pungent citrus, loads of supple grapefruit.  Long sweet sticky malt.  Big hop juice.  Long gentle grapefruit bitterness with notes of candied grapefruit.
Growler shared by Jay. Pours cloudy gold. Nose/taste of hops, pineapple, caramel malt and grapefruit. Dry pine finish. Lots of fresh hops in the nose. Medium body.
Golden; leafy, peach and herb aroma; simple and dry.  Flavor is clean and richly green; dry and crisp palate has surprising weight.  Simple, as expected, but bright in its strong singular flavor.
Draft/growler courtesy of Owen, thanks man!  Cloudy yellow, massive off white head, incredible lacing. Aroma of freshly mown grass. Tastes balancedwithpine, grass, bitter finish. Nice stuff.

Poured from a 2L HFS growler filled yesterday. Into HFS glass, pours a hazy yellow straw color. small head, soapy looking. clinging lacing. Smells piney resinous with a grainy husk and bready malt. sweet candy peach, apricot finish, no alcohol to smell. Taste is rich with hop flavors starting with pine going to citrus peach nectarine. grainy maltiness. finish is grain husk, touch of sweet wiped away by a moderate bitterness. no alcohol to taste. mouthfeel is medium body, low carbonation but just enough. touch of alcohol to feel. Overall an enjoyable beer
